means: 浸( dip的过去式和过去分词 )
（把烛芯浸在融蜡里）制造（蜡烛）
把（汽车前灯）的远光调为近光

sentence.Network_en: Blake jumped in expertly; the boat dipped slightly under his weight.
sentence.Network_cn: 布莱克很熟练地跳上了船，他的重量使小船微微向下沉了沉。

sentence.Network_en: This picture shows the view from a car using normal dipped lights.
sentence.Network_cn: 这幅图片显示的是从一辆使用正常近光灯的汽车上所看到的景色。

sentence.Network_en: The left wing dipped until it was perpendicular to the ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 左翼下垂至与地面成90度角。

PerfectNetExp.abs: I like to eat dumplings dipped in vinegar ., 我喜欢蘸点醋吃饺子.
Grating shall be hot dipped galvanized., 栅栏应该经过热浸镀锌处理.
The Lord again dipped into the river ., 上帝又把手伸进河里.
(4)在本条内，“向下斜射”(dipped) 指由一盏灯所发出的向下折射，或同时向下及向左折射的光束，其折射程度是任何人如与该汽车处于同一水平面.

entry.def: If you dip something in a liquid, you put it into the liquid for a short time, so that only part of it is covered, and take it out again.

example.ex: They dip the food into the sauce...
example.tran: 他们把食物放到调味汁里蘸了蘸。

example.ex: Quickly dip the base in and out of cold water.
example.tran: 把底部在冷水中快速地浸一下后拿出来。

entry.def: If you dip your hand into a container or dip into the container, you put your hand into it in order to take something out of it.

example.ex: She dipped a hand into the jar of sweets and pulled one out...
example.tran: 她把手伸进糖果罐，摸出了一颗糖。

example.ex: Watch your fingers as you dip into the pot...
example.tran: 把手伸进锅里时当心你的手指头。

entry.tran: (通常指迅速地)下降，下落，下沉
entry.def: If something dips, it makes a downward movement, usually quite quickly.

example.ex: Blake jumped in expertly; the boat dipped slightly under his weight...
example.tran: 布莱克很熟练地跳上了船，他的重量使小船微微向下沉了沉。

example.ex: The sun dipped below the horizon.

entry.tran: 陡然下降;凹下去;突然下倾
entry.def: If an area of land, a road, or a path dips, it goes down quite suddenly to a lower level.

example.ex: The road dipped and rose again.
example.tran: 道路陡然沉下去又升上来。

example.ex: ...a path which suddenly dips down into a tunnel.
example.tran: 突然下降进入一条隧道的小路

entry.def: When farmers dip sheep or other farm animals, they put them into a container of liquid with chemicals in it, in order to kill harmful insects which live on the animals' bodies.

example.ex: Their father was helping to dip the sheep.
example.tran: 他们的父亲在帮忙给羊群洗药浴。

entry.def: Dip is a liquid with chemicals in it which animals or objects can be dipped in to disinfect or clean them.

entry.tran: (数量或水平，通常短暂地)下降，下跌，减少
entry.def: If the amount or level of something dips, it becomes smaller or lower, usually only for a short period of time.

example.ex: Unemployment dipped to 6.9 per cent last month...
The president became more cautious as his popularity dipped.
example.tran: 由于支持率有所下降，总统变得更加谨慎了。

entry.tran: 蘸酱;(蘸蔬菜或饼干吃的)调味酱，果酱
entry.def: A dip is a thick creamy sauce. You dip pieces of raw vegetable or biscuits into the sauce and then eat them.

example.ex: Maybe we could just buy some dips.
example.tran: 或许我们可以只买一点儿蘸酱。

entry.def: If you have or take a dip, you go for a quick swim in the sea, a river, or a swimming pool.

example.ex: She flicked through a romantic paperback between occasional dips in the pool.
example.tran: 用在泳池里游一阵后歇一阵的几个空当，她翻完了一本平装本言情小说。

entry.def: If you are driving a car and dip the headlights, you operate a switch that makes them shine downwards, so that they do not shine directly into the eyes of other drivers.

example.ex: He dipped his headlights as they came up behind a slow-moving van...
example.tran: 当他们靠近一辆缓慢行驶的货车时，他把汽车前灯调成了近光。

example.ex: This picture shows the view from a car using normal dipped lights.
example.tran: 这幅图片显示的是从一辆使用正常近光灯的汽车上所看到的景色。

entry.def: If you dip into a book, you have a brief look at it without reading or studying it seriously.

example.ex: ...a chance to dip into a wide selection of books on Buddhism.

entry.def: If you dip into a sum of money that you had intended to save, you use some of it to buy something or pay for something.

example.ex: Just when she was ready to dip into her savings, Greg hastened to her rescue.
example.tran: 正当她准备动用自己的存款时，格雷格赶来给她救了急。

means.word_mean: 1. having abnormal sagging of the spine (especially in horses)

auth_sentence.content: Certainly, with the cut end dipped in sugar.
auth_sentence.res_content: Certainly, with the cut end dipped in sugar.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Certainly, with the cut end dipped in sugar.

auth_sentence.content: Cloths being dipped in the water and squeezed out.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cloths being dipped in the water and squeezed out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cloths being dipped in the water and squeezed out.

auth_sentence.content: Supper was over and the dishes dipped and wiped.
auth_sentence.res_content: Supper was over and the dishes dipped and wiped.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Supper was over and the dishes dipped and wiped.

Sentence.sentence: The result is a sort of high-quality, unusually rigorous coffee-table book, designed to be dipped into rather than read from beginning to end.
After the personal-savings rate dipped to zero in 2005, the shock of the economic crisis last year prompted people to snap shut their wallets.
While the school usually graduated about 90% of its whites, the graduation rate of its blacks and Latinos had dipped to 63% by 2007.
